details.description: You must tell DVLA if you suffer from psychosis
details.body:
You must tell DVLA if you suffer from psychosis.

You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.

Car or motorbike licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in the ‘M1 questionnaire’ and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

Download ‘M1 medical fitness to drive questionnaire’ (PDF, 252KB)

Bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in the ‘M1V questionnaire’ and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

Download ‘M1V medical fitness to drive questionnaire’ (PDF, 243KB)
